Posts.Content: I have just been diagnosed and have been doing yoga for about 5 years now I'm determined to carry on with it as far as possible...great for relaxation and helping with breathing technique...My local studio actually does a c,ass for cancer survivors...and my current teacher at the gym actually had bc years ago...as did some of the other class members....anything that will help is worth a try...it's early days for me so easy to say I might change my mind in a few months hopefully not....
Posts.Title: Yoga

Posts.Content: I saw my surgeon yesterday .....he is foreign but to be fair I've been impressed so far.....I think sometimes when there's so much info to take in it doesn't matter who is delivering the news but good you had friends with you...I took my partner and friend last week mainly for friend to take notes in case we missed something in the emotional haze.... I'm same as you had option of lumpectomy or mastectomy...a stage 2 lump with no indication of cells in nodes at minute but they are suspicious as swollen so having sentinel biopsy as well as lumpectomy on 28th...it's early days for us both and I fear my nodes are involved just biopsy hasn't proven it yet.....stay strong and take any help from your friends ...keep busy until then and stay strong....
Posts.Title: Saw Surgeon
